result.execSummary:
The defendant Aaron J Weaver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).
  • Forgery, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Per C-31.
Must make $100.00 monthly payments starting within 60 days.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants work search and work release.
Must report to jail today, October 1, 2014, by 4:00 PM.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 1 together with conditions except for jail time.

records.addlTxt: of jury trial cancellation for trial that was scheduled for 10/15/14.

Defendant Aaron J Weaver in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State relates agreement. 
Defendant pleads guilty to count 1 and 2. Court accepts the pleas and finds the defendant guilty. All remaining counts are dismissed and read in. 

Parties waive PSI. 
Felony admonitions and voters rights discussed. 
Victim Impact Statement filed. 
Defense relates. Court questions Defendant. 

Court relates and orders: 

SW
2 years probation on each count.
Count 1 - 60 days jail with work search and work release. Must report to jail today, October 1, 2014 by 4:00 PM. 
Costs 
$1055.28 Restitution per C-31. Must make $100.00 monthly payments starting within 60 days.   
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.  
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.  

Review hearing set. If payments are current Defendant does not need to appear. 
JAIL FAXED.
Jury trial on October 15, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Aaron J Weaver in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Hinde relates.  JT 10/15/14 #1 -  Plea hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
